paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: The key question is whether TRAPPIST-1 b retains any atmosphere under strong stellar irradiation, using JWST MIRI phase-curve spectroscopy to constrain day-night heat transport and atmospheric composition.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: TRAPPIST-1 b observations
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: One rocky exoplanet with phase-resolved thermal spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: JWST MIRI low-resolution spectroscopy observations of TRAPPIST-1 b over an orbital phase curve, capturing thermal phase variation and spectral structure around the 15 um CO2 band.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Bare-rock null model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: No-atmosphere model with minimal heat redistribution
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Null scenario representing a bare-rock, no-atmosphere model with minimal heat redistribution, used as a baseline comparison for atmosphere-bearing scenarios.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Atmosphere model with significant greenhouse gas absorption
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere-bearing scenario with CO2-rich composition, featuring significant greenhouse gas absorption and moderate-pressure (0.3-1.0 bar) solutions favored by retrievals.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Oxidized composition with weaker CO2 signature constraints
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere scenario with oxidized composition (O2-rich), which remains plausible as current data do not fully rule out this interpretation.

major_limitations: This is a single-planet study and does not establish atmospheric prevalence across all M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, cloud treatment) affect quantitative posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.
